aboutUs.title: 33+ of Scaffolding Experience
aboutUs.description:
Since 1993, ACHI Scaffolding has delivered engineered scaffolding and temporary works solutions across Lebanon. 
Our experience spans construction, industrial, and complex urban projects, where reliability, safety, and execution discipline are critical.

clients.title: Clients Overview
clients.description: ACHI Scaffolding supports contractors, developers, and engineers with execution-ready access systems and scaffolding solutions across construction and industrial projects.

vision.title: Our vision
vision.description: At Achi Scaffolding, we're charting a visionary course towards a future where scaffolding isn't merely a structural necessity; it's an embodiment of innovation, unparalleled safety, and sustainable advancement, defining the infrastructure of tomorrow.

mission.title: the mission
mission.description:
We specialize in comprehensive scaffolding services, from rental to installation,
 and sell and export a diverse range of new and used construction equipment in the Middle East and Africa.

values.title: Values
values.firstValueDescription: Ensuring a safe environment for our workers and clients is paramount.
values.secondValueDescription: We deliver only the highest quality in all our projects.
values.thirdValueDescription: We embrace the latest technologies and methodologies in the scaffolding industry.
values.fourthValueDescription: We prioritize eco-friendly practices for a better future
values.fifthValueDescription: Building strong and lasting relationships with our clients and suppliers.
values.sixthValueDescription: We operate with transparency, honesty, and ethical standards.

whychoseus.firstCardDescription: With a team of highly skilled professionals and years of experience in the scaffolding industry, we bring a wealth of expertise to every project. We've successfully completed complex and challenging projects, earning a reputation for delivering quality workmanship.
whychoseus.secondCardDescription: At ACHI Scaffolding, exceptional client communication and service are at the core of our values. We believe in building strong partnerships with our clients, and our team is dedicated to understanding your needs.
whychoseus.thirdCardDescription: We stand out because of our vast and diverse inventory of scaffolding equipment and materials. Whether your project is large or small, we have the resources to meet your specific requirements.
whychoseus.fourthCardDescription: Your project's success is our top priority. When you work with us, you can count on immediate assistance whenever you need it. Whether it's a question, an urgent request, or on-site support, our responsive team of scaffolding experts is always ready to assist you promptly.
whychoseus.fifthCardDescription: ACHI Scaffolding is proud to have an in house engineering team that provides valuable insights, designs custom solutions, and ensures the structural integrity and safety of your scaffolding. Our engineering expertise adds an extra layer of reliability and confidence to your project.
whychoseus.sixthCardDescription: Our unwavering vision is to set a paradigm shift in the scaffolding industry, a world where safety isn't just a priority but an art form. We aspire to design scaffolding solutions that not only meet regulatory standards but transcend them.
whychoseus.seventhCardDescription: We're driven to revolutionize scaffolding by developing smarter, safer, and more adaptive solutions that elevate industry standards.
whychoseus.eighthCardDescription: We deliver scaffolding solutions that stand the test of time through precision, experience, and uncompromising quality standards.

seo.title: A Scaffolding Contractor Focused on Execution, Safety, and Reliability | ACHI Scaffolding
seo.description: ACHI Scaffolding is an industrial and construction scaffolding contractor and equipment provider delivering access systems, shoring, and scaffolding solutions for restoration, infrastructure, and complex building projects.

schema.name: ACHI Scaffolding
schema.description: ACHI Scaffolding is an industrial and construction scaffolding contractor and equipment provider delivering access systems, shoring, and scaffolding solutions for restoration, infrastructure, and complex building projects.

hero.panelBody: Since its establishment in 1993 by engineer Barbar Achi, Achi Scaffolding has evolved into a reputable provider of expert scaffolding and formwork services in Lebanon. Our professional team takes immense pride in building a solid foundation of trust by delivering reliable and high-quality scaffold structures for diverse projects, including shopping malls, towers, residential buildings, and universities.

main.h1: A SCAFFOLDING CONTRACTOR FOCUSED ON EXECUTION, SAFETY, AND RELIABILITY
main.srOnly: ACHI Scaffolding is an industrial and construction scaffolding contractor and equipment provider delivering access systems, shoring, and scaffolding solutions for restoration, infrastructure, and complex building projects.
main.p1: Achi Scaffolding provides professional scaffolding, formwork and shoring solutions for commercial, residential and industrial projects across Lebanon and the region. We combine field experience with engineered solutions to deliver safe, reliable and cost-effective systems.
main.p2: ACHI Scaffolding operates at the intersection of construction execution and access engineering. We provide scaffolding systems that are designed to meet real-world site conditions, not idealized drawings.

bullets.b2: Industrial environments with strict safety constraints
bullets.b3: Construction sites requiring scalable and adaptable access

main.p3: We focus on doing fewer things better, ensuring every system we deliver is safe, compliant, and adapted to the project’s operational reality.

mission.title: OUR MISSION
mission.body: We specialize in comprehensive scaffolding services, from rental and installation to design and export of new and used construction equipment across the Middle East and Africa. Our mission is to provide engineered, safe and timely solutions that help clients deliver their projects on schedule.

vision.title: OUR VISION
vision.body: To make scaffolding a symbol of innovation, sustainability and safety in the built environment. We aim to lead the industry by improving standards, investing in skilled crews and supplying modern systems that reduce risk and increase productivity.

aishti-mall.seoTitle: Aïshti Mall, Metn, Lebanon | Project Details | ACHI Scaffolding
aishti-mall.seoDescription: Façade & Interior Scaffolding for Aïshti Mall, Metn, Lebanon
aishti-mall.heading: Façade & Interior Scaffolding for Aïshti Mall, Metn, Lebanon
paragraphs: Project Overview
This project involved the delivery of façade and interior scaffolding solutions for Aïshti Mall, a large-scale mixed-use commercial development in Beirut.
The scope required engineered access systems integrated within an active construction environment, supporting complex architectural and finishing works across multiple levels.
Scope of Scaffolding Works
The scaffolding systems were designed and installed to support both external façade works and internal construction activities, including:
Façade scaffolding for exterior envelope and finishing works
Internal scaffolding to support circulation areas and architectural elements
Multi-level access aligned with phased construction sequencing
Installation and dismantling coordinated with site progress
Each configuration was adapted to evolving site conditions rather than relying on standard layouts.
Site Constraints & Execution Strategy
The project presented several execution challenges:
Large building footprint within a dense urban corridor
Simultaneous façade and interior works
Height variations and complex architectural geometry
Coordination with other trades operating in parallel
Scaffolding solutions were installed in controlled phases, ensuring continuous access while maintaining clear circulation paths and operational efficiency across the site.
Safety & Coordination
Safety and coordination were central to execution:
Scaffolding layouts planned in coordination with contractors and consultants
Controlled interfaces between scaffolding structures and ongoing works
Continuous alignment with site logistics and sequencing
This approach ensured stable access conditions for workers while preserving safety standards throughout the project lifecycle.
Project Outcome
The scaffolding systems provided reliable, safe, and adaptable access for façade and interior works, supporting uninterrupted construction progress on a high-profile commercial development.
Location & Service Coverage
This project was delivered in Metn, Lebanon.
Achi scaffolding services are delivered across Beirut, Mount Lebanon, North Lebanon, South Lebanon, and the Bekaa, supporting a wide range of commercial, residential, and industrial developments.
Discuss a Similar Project
For façade, interior, or renovation scaffolding on complex commercial developments, contact our team to review access requirements, site constraints, and execution strategy.
[Contact Us]

beirut-business-center.seoTitle: Beirut Business Center BBC, Sin El Fil, Lebanon | Project Details | ACHI Scaffolding
beirut-business-center.seoDescription: Façade, Structural & Temporary Works for Beirut Business Center (BBC), Beirut, Lebanon
beirut-business-center.heroTitle: Beirut Business Center BBC, Sin El Fil, Lebanon
beirut-business-center.heading: Façade, Structural & Temporary Works for Beirut Business Center (BBC), Beirut, Lebanon
paragraphs: Project Overview
This project involved the execution of façade scaffolding, structural access systems, and temporary works for Beirut Business Center (BBC), a high-rise commercial development located in Beirut.

The scope required engineering-led access and logistics solutions integrated within an active urban construction environment, supporting works at height while maintaining efficient ground-level operations.
Scope of Works
The project combined multiple temporary works packages delivered in coordination with the main construction program:
Façade scaffolding for external envelope and elevation works
Structural scaffolding supporting construction activities at multiple levels
Multi-level access platforms aligned with floor-by-floor sequencing
Installation, adaptation, and dismantling coordinated with site progress
All systems were designed and configured based on actual site constraints rather than standardized layouts.
Site Constraints & Execution Strategy
Execution was shaped by the specific conditions of a large-scale urban high-rise project:
Limited ground-level working space within a dense city corridor
Vertical construction requiring continuous access and structural stability
Concurrent façade, structural, and finishing activities
Interfaces with cranes, formwork, and other temporary works
Scaffolding systems were installed in phased vertical sections, allowing construction activities to progress efficiently while maintaining controlled access and organized site circulation.
Temporary Access Road & Site Logistics
As part of the overall temporary works scope, a temporary access road was constructed to link one project block to the main road, enabling controlled vehicle entry into the site.
The access route was planned to:
Accommodate construction traffic and material deliveries
Improve internal site circulation and logistics efficiency
Integrate safely with scaffolding structures and ongoing works
This solution reduced congestion, improved material flow, and ensured uninterrupted access throughout the construction phases.
Safety & Coordination
Safety and coordination were embedded throughout planning and execution:
Scaffolding and temporary works coordinated with contractors and consultants
Defined load paths, access routes, and controlled interfaces
Continuous alignment with site logistics and construction sequencing
This approach ensured safe working conditions for site teams while maintaining steady project progress.
Project Outcome

The combined scaffolding and temporary works solutions provided stable access, efficient logistics, and controlled execution, supporting façade and structural works on a landmark commercial tower in Beirut.
Location & Service Coverage
This project was delivered in Beirut, Lebanon.
Scaffolding and temporary works solutions are provided across Beirut, Mount Lebanon, North Lebanon, South Lebanon, and the Bekaa, supporting commercial, residential, and industrial developments.
Discuss a Similar Project
For façade scaffolding, high-rise access, or temporary works on complex construction projects, contact our team to review site constraints, access requirements, and execution strategy.
[Contact Us]

hotel-le-gray.seoTitle: Hotel Le Gray, Beirut, Lebanon | Project Details | ACHI Scaffolding
hotel-le-gray.seoDescription: Façade Scaffolding for Hotel Le Gray, Beirut
hotel-le-gray.heading: Façade Scaffolding for Hotel Le Gray, Beirut
paragraphs: Project Context
Hotel Le Gray, located in the dense urban fabric of downtown Beirut, required external access scaffolding to support façade-related activities carried out by other project teams.
The building remained operational throughout the works, requiring a scaffolding solution adapted to a public-facing hospitality environment.
Scope of Scaffolding Services
Our involvement was limited to the design, installation, and dismantling of façade scaffolding, providing safe and reliable access for external works:
Façade access scaffolding along building elevations
Configurations adapted to architectural detailing and height variations
Phased installation aligned with site coordination requirements
Dismantling upon completion of access needs
No renovation or façade works were executed by our team.
Operational & Urban Constraints
The project presented conditions distinct from conventional construction sites:
Active hotel operations with continuous guest and staff circulation
High pedestrian exposure in adjacent streets
Limited ground space for staging and access
Visual and safety sensitivity due to the public environment
Scaffolding systems were installed in controlled phases, ensuring safe access for works while maintaining clear separation from hotel and public areas.
Safety & Interface Control
Given the operational setting, safety and interface management were critical:
Physical separation between scaffolding zones and public access points
Defined circulation routes and protective measures
Continuous coordination with site representatives and hotel management
These measures ensured safe conditions for workers, guests, and surrounding pedestrian areas.
Project Outcome
The façade scaffolding system provided stable, discreet, and secure access, enabling external works to proceed without disrupting hotel operations or public circulation.
Project Location
This scaffolding project was delivered in downtown Beirut, within a high-density urban and commercial setting.
Discuss a Similar Project
For façade scaffolding on occupied buildings, hotels, or sensitive urban sites, contact our team to review access requirements and execution constraints.
[Contact Us]

1.seoTitle: Scaffolding in Lebanon: Industry Challenges and the Lack of Formal Regulation | ACHI Blog
1.seoDescription: Scaffolding in Lebanon plays a critical role in construction and temporary works, yet the industry operates with limited formal regulation and inconsistent standards. Learn how engineering-led scaffolding helps manage risk and improve outcomes.
1.h1: Scaffolding in Lebanon: Industry Challenges and the Lack of Formal Regulation
1.imageAlt: Scaffolding in Lebanon blog article cover image
takeaways: Lebanon lacks unified scaffolding regulation, resulting in inconsistent standards across projects.
Engineering-led scaffolding improves safety, planning, and performance in under-regulated environments.
Raising internal procedures and benchmarks is often the most effective path to reducing operational risk.

regulatoryContext.title: The Regulatory Context for Scaffolding in Lebanon
regulatoryContext.p1: Unlike markets where scaffolding systems and temporary works are governed by detailed national codes, Lebanon relies largely on general construction practices and project-specific requirements.
bullets: There is no unified scaffolding regulation at a national level.
Standards for scaffolding installation and use vary between projects.
Oversight depends heavily on consultants, developers, or contractor policies.
regulatoryContext.p3: This fragmented framework leads to inconsistent approaches to scaffolding design, installation, and safety management.

risks.title: Risks Associated with Limited Scaffolding Standards
risks.p1: When scaffolding is treated primarily as a rental activity rather than a technical system, several risks may arise:
bullets: Variable safety levels across construction sites.
Limited engineering review of scaffolding and temporary works.
Reactive solutions driven by schedule pressure.
Increased exposure on high-rise and urban scaffolding projects.
risks.p2: These risks are amplified on occupied buildings, commercial developments, and dense urban sites, where scaffolding interfaces directly with the public environment.

engineeringLed.title: The Importance of Engineering-Led Scaffolding
engineeringLed.p1: In the absence of strict regulation, engineering-led scaffolding solutions play a key role in managing risk.
bullets: Planned access strategies rather than improvised scaffolding.
Compatibility between scaffolding systems and structural conditions.
Coordination with other temporary works such as shoring and formwork.
Alignment with real site constraints and execution sequencing.
engineeringLed.p2: This approach helps standardize performance even where formal rules are limited.

beyondCompliance.title: Responsibility Beyond Minimum Compliance
beyondCompliance.p1: On many projects in Lebanon, compliance is defined by what is accepted on site rather than by formal scaffolding standards.
beyondCompliance.p2: Professional scaffolding contractors increasingly recognize that:
bullets: Safety should not rely solely on regulation.
Temporary works deserve structured planning.
Internal procedures and controls reduce operational and reputational risk.
beyondCompliance.p3: Raising internal benchmarks is often the most effective way to manage scaffolding safety in under-regulated environments.

evolvingExpectations.title: Evolving Expectations in the Lebanese Construction Sector
evolvingExpectations.p1: Developers, consultants, and international stakeholders operating in Lebanon are placing greater emphasis on how scaffolding services and temporary works are delivered.
bullets: Documented scaffolding planning.
Defined roles and responsibilities.
Predictable installation and dismantling processes.
Reduced exposure to safety and operational risk.
evolvingExpectations.p3: This shift reinforces the value of working with experienced scaffolding contractors in Lebanon.

movingForward.title: Moving the Scaffolding Industry Forward
movingForward.p1: Improving scaffolding practices does not depend only on new regulations. It also depends on how contractors choose to operate today.
bullets: Treating scaffolding as a technical scope, not a commodity.
Applying engineering discipline to access and temporary works.
Prioritizing planning, coordination, and safety culture.
movingForward.p3: These practices help elevate industry standards project by project.

finalPerspective.title: Final Perspective
finalPerspective.p1: The lack of formal scaffolding regulation in Lebanon presents both challenges and responsibility. In such environments, engineering judgment, structured execution, and professional discipline become the primary safeguards of safety and project performance.

cta.title: Discuss Your Scaffolding Requirements
cta.p1: For scaffolding and temporary works in Lebanon, working with an engineering-led contractor helps reduce uncertainty and improve outcomes on complex or high-risk projects.
cta.p2: Request project support to review site conditions, access requirements, and execution constraints.

1.conclusion: In under-regulated environments, consistent scaffolding performance depends on engineering judgment, structured planning, and disciplined execution, project by project.

2.seoTitle: What Are Temporary Works in Construction? | ACHI Blog
2.seoDescription: Temporary works enable safe, efficient construction sequencing. Learn what temporary works are, common types, and why engineering-led planning is critical on complex projects.
2.h1: What Are Temporary Works in Construction?
2.imageAlt: Temporary works in construction blog article cover image
takeaways: Temporary works support safe construction sequencing until permanent works become self-supporting.
Scaffolding, shoring, and formwork are key temporary systems that directly affect safety and stability.
Engineering-led planning reduces risk and improves predictability on complex and urban sites.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.p1: Temporary works are a critical but often misunderstood part of construction projects. They enable permanent works to be built safely, efficiently, and in sequence, yet they are not part of the final structure.
intro.p2: Understanding what temporary works are, and why they matter, is essential for developers, engineers, and contractors involved in complex construction environments.

definition.title: Definition of Temporary Works
definition.p1: In construction, temporary works refer to all structures, systems, and measures required to support construction activities until permanent works become self-supporting.
definition.p2: They are designed for limited duration use, but they directly affect:
bullets: Site safety
Structural stability
Construction sequencing
Project efficiency
definition.p3: Despite their temporary nature, their impact on project performance is permanent.

commonTypes.title: Common Types of Temporary Works
commonTypes.p1: Temporary works cover a wide range of applications across construction and industrial projects, including:
bullets: Scaffolding systems for access and working platforms
Shoring and propping systems to support structural elements
Formwork used to shape and hold concrete
Temporary access structures such as ramps or platforms
Protective structures for public and site safety
commonTypes.p2: Each type serves a specific function and must align with site conditions and construction methodology.

whyCritical.title: Why Temporary Works Are Critical
whyCritical.p1: Temporary works are not auxiliary elements, they are enabling systems.
whyCritical.p2: They play a central role in:
bullets: Allowing construction activities to proceed safely
Supporting loads during intermediate construction stages
Managing access on high-rise, urban, or constrained sites
Protecting workers, the public, and adjacent structures
whyCritical.p3: Failures or misalignment in temporary works can disrupt schedules, increase risk, and affect overall project outcomes.

vsPermanent.title: Temporary Works vs Permanent Works
vsPermanent.p1: A key distinction in construction planning is between temporary and permanent works.
vsPermanent.p2: Permanent works remain as part of the completed structure. Temporary works are removed once their function is complete.
vsPermanent.p3: However, temporary works often carry significant loads and interact directly with permanent structures during construction, making their planning just as critical.

engineeringRole.title: The Role of Engineering in Temporary Works
engineeringRole.p1: Effective temporary works rely on engineering-led planning, not improvised solutions.
bullets: Compatibility with structural and architectural conditions
Alignment with construction sequencing
Controlled interfaces with other site activities
Predictable performance throughout their use period
engineeringRole.p3: In complex or under-regulated environments, engineering discipline becomes the primary safeguard.

complexUrban.title: Temporary Works in Complex and Urban Projects
complexUrban.p1: Temporary works are especially critical on projects involving:
bullets: High-rise construction
Dense urban environments
Occupied buildings
Industrial or infrastructure works
complexUrban.p2: In these contexts, temporary systems must integrate access, safety, and logistics within tight spatial and operational constraints.

riskManagement.title: Responsibility and Risk Management
riskManagement.p1: Temporary works carry responsibility beyond installation.
bullets: Clear definition of scope and responsibilities
Coordination with contractors and consultants
Ongoing monitoring throughout their use
Timely modification or removal as project conditions evolve
riskManagement.p3: Treating temporary works as a technical scope reduces uncertainty and improves risk control.

finalPerspective.title: Final Perspective
finalPerspective.p1: Temporary works may not appear in the final building, but they play a decisive role in how that building is constructed.
finalPerspective.p2: When planned and managed with engineering discipline, temporary works support safe execution, efficient sequencing, and predictable project delivery.

cta.title: Discuss Your Temporary Works Requirements
cta.p1: For temporary works and scaffolding on construction projects, early planning and engineering-led coordination are essential, particularly on complex or high-risk sites.
cta.p2: Request project support to review access requirements, site constraints, and execution strategy.

2.conclusion: When planned and managed with engineering discipline, temporary works enable safe execution, efficient sequencing, and predictable delivery, especially on complex projects.

seo.description: Educational and technical resources covering scaffolding systems, applications, and decision-making for construction professionals.

sr.entityDefinition: ACHI Scaffolding is an industrial and construction scaffolding contractor and equipment provider delivering access systems, shoring, and scaffolding solutions for restoration, infrastructure, and complex building projects.

blog1.title: Scaffolding in Lebanon: Industry Challenges and the Lack of Formal Regulation
blog1.excerpt: Scaffolding in Lebanon plays a critical role in construction and temporary works, yet the industry operates with limited formal regulation and inconsistent standards. Learn how engineering-led scaffolding helps manage risk and improve outcomes.

blog2.title: What Are Temporary Works in Construction?
blog2.excerpt: Temporary works enable permanent structures to be built safely and in sequence. Learn the definition, common types, and why engineering-led planning is critical on complex projects.

blog3.title: Innovative Scaffolding Solutions for Lebanon's Unique Architectural Challenges
blog3.excerpt: Lebanon’s diverse architectural styles and terrains require creative scaffolding systems. This article highlights innovative solutions and case studies showing how modern scaffolding adapts to Lebanon’s complex construction environments.
